article.writingAngle: 项目选材指南 (project material selection guide) - help readers choose the right material based on their specific project needs

company.name: Bastone
company.coreBusiness: Manufacturing of plasticizers and PVC resin for the plastics industry. Bastone produces essential chemical additives and base materials used in polymer applications, serving as a key supplier of compounds for PVC and flexible plastic manufacturing.
company.valueProposition: As a specialized manufacturer of plasticizers and PVC resin in China, Bastone provides essential raw materials for the plastics industry with a focus on quality chemical compounds for diverse polymer applications.

do: Provide selection frameworks: 'When choosing between HDPE and PVC, consider these factors...'

userContext.situation: Reader is selecting materials for a specific project (piping, containers, construction, manufacturing) and needs to decide between HDPE and PVC. They may have heard different opinions or seen both materials used in similar applications and want to understand which is better for their needs.
userContext.currentState: Confused about the practical differences between HDPE and PVC; uncertain which material properties matter most for their application; may have budget constraints or regulatory requirements to consider; needs a clear framework for making the decision.
userContext.desiredState: Confident in selecting the right material based on specific project requirements; understands the key trade-offs between HDPE and PVC; knows which properties to prioritize for their application; can justify the material choice to stakeholders or team members.

searchIntent.coreQuestion: Which material should I choose for my specific project: HDPE or PVC, and why?
implicitQuestions: What are the key differences between HDPE and PVC that affect performance?
Which material is better for chemical resistance, temperature exposure, or UV exposure?
What are the cost differences and long-term value considerations?
Are there regulatory or safety considerations that favor one over the other?
Which material is easier to work with for installation or fabrication?
What are the common applications where each material excels?

expectedContent.format: Comparison tables + decision framework + application examples
expectedContent.depth: Practical how-to with enough technical detail to support decision-making

searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can select the appropriate material (HDPE or PVC) for their specific project based on a clear understanding of performance properties, cost-benefit analysis, regulatory requirements, and application suitability. They can confidently explain their choice and know what factors to prioritize in their decision.

goldenInsights.insight: HDPE is 205x more reliable than PVC under stress events (1:10M vs 1:48,650 failure rate)
goldenInsights.suggestedUse: hook - surprising statistic to open article

goldenInsights.insight: 14% of US drinking water is lost daily due to mechanical joint leakage (PVC-type joints)
PVC lasts only ~3 years in sunlight vs HDPE 20+ years - 7x UV durability difference
Less than 1% of PVC was recycled in US in 2020 vs HDPE being easiest plastic to recycle

controversies: PVC safety for potable water - some authorities question plasticizer leaching
research.coreThesis: The choice between HDPE and PVC is not simply about cost - it is about matching material properties to your specific application requirements. While PVC offers lower upfront costs and rigidity for simple residential applications, HDPE flexibility, fusion-welded joints, and dramatically lower failure rates make it the superior choice for demanding installations where long-term reliability matters.

cautious: chemical resistance (general data only, no specific chart extracted)

opinionsIncluded: H2-1: Default to HDPE for demanding installations despite higher upfront cost
H2-2: Flexibility beats rigidity underground - HDPE absorbs ground movement
H2-3: Calculate cost per year of service, not upfront cost
H2-4: Joint failure is the #1 cause of pipe system problems
H2-5: Never use unprotected PVC outdoors
H2-6: HDPE is clearly the greener choice
H2-7: Most selection mistakes come from prioritizing upfront cost
